sentence.Network_en: He remembered with what callousness he had watched her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他记得自己以何等无情的态度瞧着她.

sentence.Network_en: She also lacks the callousness required of a truly great leader.
sentence.Network_cn: 她还缺乏一个真正伟大领袖所应具备的铁石心肠.

sentence.Network_en: We were embittered by his callousness.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们对他的冷淡感到生气.

PerfectNetExp.abs: VOA常速讲解附字幕:墨西哥官... ... 5.multiple adj. 多重的, 多种多样的 6.callousness n. 麻木不仁 7.claim v. 夺走；夺去（生命）.

list.abs: he callously exploited their feelings ., 他无情地批判他们的感情.
Sri Lanka has callously ignored calls for a humanitarian cease - fire ., 斯里兰卡无情地忽视人道停火的呼吁.
沪江博客 - 好学深思 - 听新闻-... ... warlike 好战的 calloused hand 生硬的；起老茧的；变得无情的 ginger 姜.
沪江博客 - 好学深思 - 听新闻-... ... warlike 好战的 calloused hand 生硬的；起老茧的；变得无情的 ginger 姜.
He callously exploited their feelings ., 他无情地利用他们的感情.

entry.def: A callous person or action is very cruel and shows no concern for other people or their feelings.

auth_sentence.content: There was a callousness coming through, he felt.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was a callousness coming through, he felt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was a callousness coming through, he felt.

auth_sentence.content: The primary diagnostic feature of sociopathy is callousness—lack of feeling—toward others.
auth_sentence.res_content: The primary diagnostic feature of sociopathy is callousness—lack of feeling—toward others.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The primary diagnostic feature of sociopathy is callousness—lack of feeling—toward others.
